data.title: Sad Salad
data.text: Took first bite in Salad to find an odd piece of broken off plastic with a nozzle staring at me, when waitress came to pick up plate, did not get a real apology, just wanted to know if I wanted to order something else, as if I had an appetite after that.The last 3 times I ordered salad here I was vey unhappy, as they appear to use salad in a bag, many stems and withered blackened pieces. Sadly,this is a restaurant I have enjoyed many years before, but if a kitchen can not even take time to make a fresh salad it indicates  a complete lack of quality control or that they do not care what they serve, only how cheap and how easy. I was not the only one unhappy at our table, we will not go back, too many other choices here at this time.Their sad bread and butter in little plastic tubs are out of place with the nice ambience of the café, which has always been their biggest appeal..

data.title: Not worth a second try
data.text: I heard so much about this place and I wanted to give it a shot. It's an art gallery basically with very basic foods. Someone else said basically a deli and I agree. Not many gluten free options. My husband ordered a potato and it was very small. My son got a monte cristo and it's not fried. I stuck with a salad, it wasn't bad but it wasn't special.

data.title: Just the right ambiance... Great food!
data.text: Enjoying a great business dinner. Having the Ahi Tuna Nachos. Awesome. In the heart of the revitalized downtown. Parking is easy.

data.title: slightly above average
data.text: this place is basically a deli. The sandwiches are good. Although they brag on their bread pudding and it is good however, I recommend the eastern part of the state when it comes to bread pudding. It is usually crowed during the weekdays, but slow on weekend days. Nights are usually busy but you usually do not have to wait much. As long as you are not from New York you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Ye olde bread pudding.. RULES!
data.text:
"Our bread pudding is the best"declared the comely lass ushering us into this jovial joint.  I remember my first visit to the UK and the delightful memory of this English invention which mixes old bread with milk, eggs, sugar and spices. The version served here includes dried fruit, choc chips, rum and bourbon.
 Lovely, comfort food which raises a humble creation into a feat of delight... light bread custard topped with rum sauce, RULES!

data.title: Very pleasant dinner
data.text: We chose this restaurant because of it's varied menu and reasonable prices.  We were not disappointed.  It was a Monday evening and the weather was very rainy, so there was only one other couple dining.  Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  When we sampled the crab cakes appetizer, we were impressed with the lemon butter sauce, so the waiter brought out the chef who promptly gave us the recipe.  The cocktails were well made and the food was delightful.  We had the chicken mykonos, eggplant parmesan, rib eye steak, and fish tacos.  The food was well prepared and presented.  All in all, a very nice evening experience.

data.title: Just average
data.text: In town for mini reunion with a few college friends. They were staying at the chef's b and b. So we walked over. Virtually empty Saturday at noon. Odd. Ordered Caprese salad. Mozzarella cheese and tomatoes. Salad was small and little dressing. Have had much better elsewhere. Don't order water in Lake Charles. It tastes as bad as it smells. Order a soda but nothing using Lake Charles water. Nasty. Would I back?  Not likely.

data.title: Mrs
data.text: Server and staff was wonderful, food was horrible. No seasoning, potato was hard and not cooked all the way.. Not worth the 100 dollars I spent..

data.title: Soon Good!
data.text:
Simply amazing food. My wife and I ordered Filet Mignon and Ghicken Mykonos. Wow on all accounts...just...perfect and the bill was pleasantly reasonable!

Service slightly rough around the edges but not enough to spoil a great evening.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: I have visited Pujo Street Cafe several times ad each time, it was excellent.  The brunch is superb and as you may imagine all of the menu items are superb.  The wait staff is  courteous and friendly.  We have always been with a minimum party of 10+ and everyone was extremely complimentary of their selections.  You will love it!

data.title: Great Food and Location
data.text:
I enjoyed the business meeting dinner with my colleagues at Pujo's. We started out on the patio because it was an absolutely beautiful day in southwest LA, but the smoke was horrendous so we moved inside. The patio didn't have a good ventilation system so the smoke seemed to follow us. 
The food made up for the smoky patio. We ordered grilled shrimp salad, salmon and steak. The appetizers were the bomb - Pujo Oysters!! We ordered an additional order of those. They're just that good. TIP: Take a little French bread and dip it in the sauce. 
Great service, on the slow side. but very knowledgeable.

data.title: Great little place
data.text: Great mixed drinks, eggplant parmesan  was the best. Every one that was in our party seemed to enjoy the meal and also mixed drinks. Not a long wait on food once it was ordered.

data.title: Fresh and Friendly
data.text: Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff.  Fresh herbs growing outside, used fresh in dishes. This restaurant has an patio eating area. It is both relaxed and professional. Pujo Street Cafe offers a New Orleans "feel".

data.title: Birthday celebration
data.text: Buffet was served in the back room for a birthday celebration lunch.  Chicken,  shrimp,  salsberry steak along with mixed vegetables,  potatoes and some of the best brown gravy I've ever had.   Food quality was very good, especially considering it was buffet style for a group of about 40 people.    Intetested to return and try the regular menu.  Definitely recommended.

data.title: Fresh and tasty salads at Pujo Street Cafe
data.text: I have eaten here for lunch 5 times and have ordered a salad each time.  The chicken salad is very good!  Lettuce is always fresh and tasty.  Serving size is large so I feel like I get my monies worth. Servers are usually good unless it's a big lunch crowd and they forget refills.  Great location with adequate parking - which I appreciate during lunch break.  Always clean.  Good atmosphere.

data.title: Worth the visit
data.text: Highly recommended by many locals. Great location, great menu and great service. The Ahi Nachos were awesome. I'll be back during my next trip to LC.

data.title: Fantastic Atmosphere and menu selection
data.text: great location and architecture - local menu offerings and great service. Plenty of parking and access to other downtown attractions or historical sites.

data.title: Sunday Brunch with great bloody mary's
data.text: Needed a Sunday morning brunch site and tried Pujo Street--wonderful with great drinks, service and the best beignets I've had in Louisiana (Eat your heart out, Cafe du Monde!).

data.title: Amazing!!!!
data.text:
We hit the cafe during their non busy time and the service was wonderful. I was with my kids. 3 & 15 the waiter was very patient and friendly. The food was out of this world Monte Cristo and a mimosa for me chicken salad for 15 yr old girl and the little one of course had chicken tenders and Mac and cheese with fruit they also age Shirley Temples for them as well. 
Planning another trip soon to see if busy time of day is the same.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Beautiful place, superior value, wonderful staff and the bisque was delicious :) Midrange price, however worth every penny.  Sweet tea was southern style, perfect.
